Package aco

Class Ant

java.lang.Object
aco.Ant
public class Ant extends Object
The Ant class represents an ant in the Ant Colony Optimization (ACO) algorithm. Ants traverse the graph, constructing paths and making decisions based on pheromone levels and edge weights.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs an Ant object with the given starting node.

      public void removeCycle(int cycle_start_index)
      Removes a cycle that is not Hamiltonian by removing nodes and edges included in the cycle.
      Parameters:

    • pathIsHamiltonian

      public boolean pathIsHamiltonian(int tot_nodes)
      Checks if the path of the ant is Hamiltonian, i.e., it visits all nodes exactly once.
      Parameters:
      tot_nodes - The total number of nodes in the graph.
      Returns:
      True if the path is Hamiltonian, False otherwise.

    • resetPath

      public void resetPath()
      Resets the path of the ant by clearing the path and path edges.
